isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS AND ACCESSORIES - Using Master Diagnostics (MD 32) - Text Window and Adding Parameter Identifiers (PID)

svcproc.title: Text Window and Adding Parameter Identifiers (PID)
svcproc.para: To monitor engine parameter data in text format, first create a text window.

step1.para: Select File and then New on the menu bar to open the Select a File Type dialog box.
Select International Text View (.ntv) and click on OK.

svcproc.para: An empty Text View display window will appear. Text view windows have three columns: PID, Value, and Units. The PID column shows the PID description or acronym. The Value column shows the current data value. The Units column shows the display value units (English or metric).

step1.para: To add parameters to this window, right click in the window, then select Add/Delete Parameters on the pop-up menu.
To add parameters to the Selected Parameter list box, double click on a parameter or click on all of the desired parameters in the Available Parameter list box. Then click the >>ADD>>.

svcproc.para: The order in which PIDs are displayed in the Text View window is dependent on when a parameter is added to the Selected Parameter list. For example, a double click on the Fuel Rate first and then Fueling Pulse Width, then Fuel Rate will be displayed on top of Fueling Pulse Width in the Text View window. Use the vertical scroll bar to view additional parameters in the Available Parameters list box.
Double clicking a parameter in the Selected Parameter list will remove it from the Text View window.
To recall the original settings, click on the Defaults button to restore the attributes to the factory defaults.

step1.para: When done adding or deleting parameters and modifying the attributes, click the OK button in the ADD/DELETE PARAMETERS dialog box. The text window will display the selected parameters.

svcproc.para: This Text View window is configured and ready to be used. Opening the COM port at this time will allow the data to be displayed. The resulting window illustrates some parameter values (static data w/engine off).
By clicking on Units, the units of all the displayed parameters can be toggled between metric or English.

step1.para: To print the information in these Text View windows, select File and then Print on the menu bar.

svcproc.para: The printout can be sent to the printer or to a file.

step1.para: The configuration of these Text Views may be saved for later retrieval; the list of displayed parameters, font size, and type information is saved. The actual parameter data is not part of the configuration. Click File on the menu bar and then click Save As.

svcproc.para: The Save As file dialog box will appear. Type a file name inside the File name edit box and click Save button.
